text: Peuma () or Peumata (Πεῦματα) was a polis (city-state) of Phthiotis in ancient Thessaly. It appears documented in an inscription at Delphi that records a border conflict among Peuma, Melitaea. Peuma is also cited as having a border dispute with Phyliadon also settled by neutral arbitration. Peuma minted bronze coins that have been preserved which have been dated with the inscription «ΠΕΥΜΑΤΙΩΝ». Its site is identified with remains located at the hilltop east of the village in the Municipality of Pharsala. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Thessaly Category:Former populated places in Greece Category:Achaea Phthiotis Category:Thessalian city-states
